HPI 8272 Subaru Legacy RS 1993 Rally della Lana 5th Place P. Liatti/A. Alessandrini



Piero Liatta & Alessandro Alessandrini drove this ART Engineering-sponsored Subaru Legacy RS in the 1993 Rally della Lana. Italy-based ART Engineering was founded in 1988 by co-driver Alessandro Alessandrini and his brother Paolo. ART Engineering raced Lancia Deltas in 1991 & 1992 but switched to Subaru for 1993 after Lancia’s exit from rallying.

The 1993 Rally della Lana was a round in the Italian and European rally championships. Liatti & Alessandrini climbed as high as 2nd place but finished the rally in 5th. Liatti continued driving Subarus for ART Engineering through 1995 and then for the Subaru works team. The high point of his career came in 1997 when he won the new WRC-spec Impreza’s first rally - the Rallye Monte Carlo.
